content: I was thinking of planting my zucchini and eggplants near each other since they're both warm-season crops, but I'm worried about overcrowding. Do you think it's a good idea to plant them together, or should I space them out across the garden? By the way, I spent 4 hours on Saturday tilling the soil and preparing the beds for the warmer weather, and I added a 2-inch layer of compost to the entire garden.
